revised_title: The Impact of Glare on Visual Perception: A Study on Brightness Difference Threshold
tldr: This study investigates the effect of glare on the brightness difference threshold, which is the minimum difference in brightness that can be perceived between two adjacent test fields. The research shows that the threshold increases when an unshielded light source, or glare, is introduced into the visual field. The findings can be applied to practical illumination problems, such as designing street lighting installations for optimal visibility conditions.
